articles.description: Voltz Labs Co-founder and CEO Simon Jones talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about using DeFi for interest rate swaps, the unfriendly regulatory environment in the US right now, emerging economies becoming crypto hubs, and the "cartoonishly large" market opportunity for DeFi.
articles.title: Voltz Labs CEO: DeFi Innovation Is Moving Offshore Because of US Regulatory Severity

articles.description: MoonPay CEO Ivan Soto-Wright talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about how NFTs are clearly not "waning," how MoonPay works with brands like Puma and Nike to manage their Web3 plays and smart contracts, and how NFTs and crypto will go mainstream when they can integrate in our daily lives—and his prediction that brands will drive that.
articles.title: MoonPay CEO: Next Phase of NFT Adoption Will Come From 'Brands You Love in Your Everyday Life'

articles.description: Brandon Potts, a principal at Web3 VC firm Framework Ventures, spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about his investment focus, his outlook on crypto regulation right now, and why he's optimistic for the industry even amid the bear market and recent regulatory actions.
articles.title: Framework Ventures Is 'Optimistic That Regulators Are Much More Educated' About Crypto Than in Past

articles.description: Fanny Lakoubay, the founder of art advisory and agency LAL Art, talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about what LAL Art does, how it works with artists, museums, directors, and galleries, and why artists in Web3 have to "reinvent themselves every six months."
articles.title: Why LAL Art Has 'No Interest In Just Putting the Traditional Art Market on the Blockchain'

articles.description: Anjali Young, the co-founder of Abridged and Collab.Land, talked to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about the origins of Collab.Land and says it erupted thanks to Covid, which created not just new interest in crypto but the need for better tools for DAO member collaboration.
articles.title: Collab.Land Grew 'Because of Covid' Creating Need for DAO Tools: Co-founder Anjali Young

articles.description: Visual artist Mat Collishaw, who uses mixed media to explore beauty, is about to launch Heterosis, a metaverse art experience with dynamic NFTs hosted by OG.Art. He spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how he came to Web3.
articles.title: Artist Mat Collishaw is Exploring the 'Mutability' of NFTs

articles.description: Samir Addamine, Co-founder and CEO of Web3 CRM software company Absolute Labs, told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris that big consumer brands are rushing to figure out crypto wallets and how they can harness them for their marketing purposes and to deepen ties with customers.
articles.title: Absolute Labs CEO: Big Brands Are Trying to Understand and Harness Crypto Wallets

articles.description: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.
articles.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'

articles.description: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX, the exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.
articles.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'

articles.description: Neal Stephenson coined the term “metaverse” in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel “Snow Crash.” Now he’s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in “Snow Crash,” goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse

articles.description: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.
articles.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver

articles.description: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.
articles.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'

articles.description: Miguel Faus funded his upcoming film "Calladita" via NFT sales and a prize grant from Decentralized Pictures and Steven Soderbergh. He told Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how the film process is progressing and how Web3 moves so quickly that the NFT funding model he used is already a thing of the past and other filmmakers need to find other ways to keep pushing the envelope.
articles.title: 'Calladita' Director Says NFT Funding Model He Used Is Already Gone Because Web3 Moves So Fast

articles.description: Coinbase protocols lead Jesse Pollak sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2023 to talk about the company's innovation strategy and its plans to keep "iterating quickly" on products like Coinbase NFT and its newly announced Layer-2 blockchain Base and its efforts to become an "on-chain-native company."
articles.title: Coinbase Protocols Lead Talks Plans for Base and NFT Marketplace

articles.description: Josie Bellini, NFT artist and creator of CyberBrokers, tells Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris how CyberBrokers creates "missions and quests" for its holders to complete that lead them to other hubs like Cryptovoxels, Mona, and other projects "so that we're not just in our own silo."
articles.title: How CyberBrokers Creates Quests Across Multiple NFT Communities: Josie Bellini

articles.description: Bolero co-founder and CEO William Bailey tells Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris how Bolero works, the vision behind letting fans of an artist own a piece of a song, the future for music NFTs, and how Web3 can change the music industry broadly.
articles.title: Web3 Music Platform Bolero Wants to 'Put a Record Label in Everyone's Pocket'

articles.description: French electronic music producer DJ Agoria told Decrypt's Dan Roberts what excites him most about music NFTs, how it informs his work as a generative artist, and why Web3 is all about artists exploring "new ideas that were not possible in Web2."
articles.title: 'We Don't Want to Make Music NFTs Mainstream': DJ Agoria

articles.description: Adidas Web3 lead Erika Wykes-Sneyd told Decrypt's Dan Roberts the story of what prompted Adidas to get into crypto (it involves Elon Musk), what the brand has done so far with NFTs tied to physical apparel, and what it's considering next—including token-gated sneaker drops.
articles.title: How Adidas Jumped Into Web3 and What It Plans Next

articles.description: Eva Assayag, Web3 lead at Panerai, sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about Panerai's Web3 strategy, which will soon include a "digital passport" sold with every watch.
articles.title: Why 160-Year-Old Luxury Watch Maker Panerai Is Getting into NFTs

articles.description: John Karp, president of NFT Factory Paris and the founder of Non-Fungible Conference Lisbon, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the exploding Web3 community in Paris, the concept behind creating a physical gallery for NFTs, and how the existing art community understands NFTs because "everybody understands art."
articles.title: NFT Factory President: 'NFTs Will Be Active in a Bull or Bear Market'

articles.author: Christian Encila
articles.description:
The U.S. Justice Department is investigating the 2022 collapse of the TerraUSD stablecoin and is considering bringing criminal charges against the coin’s creator, Do Kwon, as reported by the Wall Street Journal.
 
The move comes after the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission filed charges against Kwon last month for allegedly misleading investors in a multibillion-dollar scam.
 
 
U.S. Justice Department Starts Move To Implicate Do Kwon
 
In May 2022, the two primary stablecoins of the crypto project Terra have fallen precipitously, prompting comparisons to the collapse of Lehman Brothers, which triggered the 2008 financial crisis.
 
At one point, the stablecoin TerraUSD, or UST, almost totally collapsed and lost its $1 peg, plummeting to $0.26. Likewise, the sibling token of TerraUSD, …
articles.title: TerraUSD: Why The U.S. Justice Department Is Now Probing The Stablecoin’s Collapse

articles.author: Caitlin Burns
articles.description: Creating with code has never been easier. Web3 tooling shows us how it can be equitable.
articles.title: AI and Crypto Are Combining to Create Web3's 'Multiplayer Era'

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
The Department of Justice (DOJ) and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) are reportedly investigating the collapse of the algorithmic stablecoin terra usd (UST) and the firm Terraform Labs. Unnamed sources say that former staff members from Terraform Labs, the company behind the Terra blockchain project, have been questioned by U.S. law enforcement.
 
Unusual Relationship: Report Claims Terraform Labs and South Korean Payment Firm Chai Under U.S. Investigation
 
After the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) filed a lawsuit against Terraform Labs and its CEO, Do Kwon, accusing them of fraud and orchestrating “a multibillion-dollar crypto-asset securities fraud,” the DOJ and FBI are allegedly investigating Terraform Labs. The Wall Street Journal’s Alexander Osipovich reports t…
articles.title: Report: DOJ and FBI Investigating Terraform Labs in Connection to Algorithmic Stablecoin Collapse

articles.author: Savannah Fortis
articles.description:
The past week was eventful in the Bitcoin and crypto market, as three top banks collapsed, triggering a crash in the prices of digital assets. Thankfully, the market saw a reversal following the Fed’s announcement of supporting banks with $25 billion.
 
Current data shows that the Bitcoin market cap has now outpaced JP Morgan Chase, Exon Mobil, Meta, and Visa and is now closely behind tech giant Tesla. 
 
Bitcoin Market Cap Spikes Above Tech Giants 
 
Bitcoin’s market cap has jumped to 11th among other assets by market capitalization. Companies Market Cap revealed that the Bitcoin market cap surged 9.7% over the last 24 hours, reaching $471.86 billion at press time.
 
 
The number one cryptocurrency has overtaken tech giant Meta, whose market cap currently is $469 billion. As of March 13, …
articles.title: Bitcoin Overtakes Meta In Market Cap As Market Recovery Continues

articles.author: Finance Magnates Staff
articles.description:
NFTs, or non-fungible tokens, have grown in popularity in recent years. These digital assets are one-of-a-kind works of art, music, and other digital content that are frequently bought and sold for millions of dollars.

But what is it about collecting NFTs that has piqued the interest of so many people? In this article, we will look at the psychology of NFT collecting as well as the allure of ownership and exclusivity.

Ownership

The sense of ownership provided by NFT collecting is one of its primary appeals. Owning an NFT represents a way for many people to own a unique and valuable digital asset that they can call their own. This sense of ownership can be extremely powerful, leading people to invest large sums of money in NFTs.

The concept…
articles.title: The Psychology of NFT Collecting: The Appeal of Ownership and Exclusivity

articles.author: Media
articles.description:
The leading fiat-crypto payment gateway, Alchemy Pay, has revealed that it has joined forces with ZD Group, the parent company of Mouette Securities, a reputable global investment fund. Within the frame of this strategic collaboration, ZD Group provides investment and shares its four financial licenses authorized by Securities and Futures Commission (SFC) and Insurance Authority (IA) of Hong Kong with Alchemy Pay, while Alchemy Pay commits to provide crypto payment solutions to all businesses in ZD Group. This collaboration aims to promote resource sharing and foster stronger business ties between the two entities.
 
It should be highlighted that ZD group has shared its Hong Kong Type 1, 4 and 9 financial services licenses granted by SFC with Alchemy Pay. The three licenses are crucial and…
articles.title: Alchemy Pay Partners With ZD Group, Parent Company of Mouette Securities, Shares Four Hong Kong Licenses and Receives Its Investment

articles.author: Damian Chmiel
articles.description:
Centralized exchange trading volumes for the USDC/USDT stablecoin pair surged 828% to $6.1 billion on 11 March 2023, as investors sought to switch from USDC to other tokens after the fallout of Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) in which Circle, the stablecoin issuer, held $3.3 billion of reserves.

USDC Faced Depeg After SVB Collapse

According to the newest market analysis published by CryptoCompare, the collapse of SVB has lifted the trading volume of the popular stablecoin, including decentralized exchanges. Additionally, CryptoCompare re…
articles.title: USDC to Tether Volumes Rise 828% amid Silicon Valley Bank Collapse

articles.author: Christian Encila
articles.description:
Singapore’s Bybit and Formula One team Oracle Red Bull Racing (RBR) have announced the launch of their joint e-sports program, Bybit Performance Accelerator. 
 
The program is designed to boost the performance of elite e-athletes participating in international competitions. 
 
 
Bybit Performance Accelerator: What Is It?
 
The Bybit Performance Accelerator program is intended to assess participants’ physical and mental well-being through regimented exercise and to assist them in gaining a competitive advantage over their competitors.
 
According to Christian Horner, Team Principal and CEO of Oracle Red Bull Racing, mental wellness is essential for all athletes in addition to physical training, and the Bybit Performance Accelerator is intended to tackle this key part of training.
 

 
 
The…
articles.title: Crypto Exchange Bybit Teams Up With Red Bull For Athlete Dev’t Program

articles.author: John Dennehy
articles.description:
Bitcoin education can change the world, but it has to be community-led, independent and focused on putting tools in students’ hands.
 
         
         
         
         
    
This is an opinion editorial by John Dennehy, founder of the My First Bitcoin education program based in El Salvador.
Community-led, independent, impartial Bitcoin education will change the world.
I know that most people would superficially agree on the importance of education, but to be honest, that is often just lip service. So, let’s break down why Bitcoin education matters so much and why we need to not only agree that it’s important, but to take action.
Bitcoin Is A Tool
Bitcoin is money, yes, of course. But that’s just scratching the surface. Bitcoin is also a tool that, when used correctly, empowers the in…
articles.title: Bitcoin Education Can Be The Foundation For Global Change, But It Must Be Local

articles.author: Savannah Fortis
articles.description:
The popular crypto exchange Coinbase has risen to challenge the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) over its sporadic enforcement actions against crucial industry players. The firm believes that the SEC should focus on essential aspects of its work, which include creating proper securities rules and guidance.
 
 
Coinbase filed an amicus brief in the ongoing insider trading case between SEC and Wahi regarding insider trading allegations against the latter, urging the court to dismiss it. 
 
This came after the Chamber of Digital Commerce (CDC) filed amicus briefs last month urging the court to dismiss the same lawsuit. In its filing, the CDC stated that the SEC’s regulation by enforcement is a threat to US digital market and its investors. 
 
SEC Should Stop Pursuing Misguided Laws…
articles.title: Coinbase Takes On SEC’s ‘Regulation by Enforcement’ Amid Crypto Market Rebound

articles.author: Eliman Dambell
articles.description:
Bitcoin moved closer to $25,000 on Tuesday, as banking withdrawals rose following the collapse of Signature Bank and Silicon Valley Bank. Reports suggest that withdrawals at the likes of JPMorgan and Citibank are nearing a ten-year high. First Republic Bank has been another major firm to fall, with its stock dropping by over 60% on Monday. Ethereum was also higher in today’s session.
 
Bitcoin
 
Bitcoin (BTC) extended recent gains on Tuesday, as prices rose higher for a fourth consecutive session.
 
Banking stocks were significantly lower to start the week, with investors seemingly moving capital towards cryptocurrencies.
 
Following a low of $21,918.20 in yesterday’s session, BTC/USD surged to an intraday peak of $24,851.62 earlier in the day.
 
 
As a result of the surge, bitcoin rose to…
articles.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: BTC Nearing $25,000 as Banks Face Exodus of Deposits

articles.author: Sergio Goschenko
articles.description:
The government of Spain has approved the resources for a new issuance of gold bullion coins, which will be directed to satisfy a higher estimated demand for these instruments. The Spanish National Coin Factory will purchase 40 million euros in high-quality gold pieces for this batch, a significantly higher amount of gold compared to the two series issued before.
Spanish National Coin Factory Prepares Gold Bullion Coin Issuance
Spain is preparing the issuance of a new gold bullion coin to satisfy the demand of the market for such instruments. In February, the government of Spain approved a budget of 40 million euros (almost $43 million) for the issuance of a new batch of gold coins. Most of the budget will be used by the National Coin Factory to purchase high-purity and quality gold to mint…
articles.title: Spain Prepares to Expand Offer of Gold Bullion Coins for Investors

articles.author: anushsamal
articles.description:
Cryptocurrency exchange, Binance, is introducing its prepaid card in Colombia, which aims at extending its scope in the Latam region. Colombia marks the third country in Latin America (Latam) to have the Binance prepaid card in the area owing to the partnership with Mastercard.
 
Last year, Argentina received the product, followed by Brazil early this year in January. With the prepaid card, identity-verified customers can make purchases and pay bills with digital assets which will establish the country as one of the top markets for Binance in the Latam region.
 
 
This Binance Card has been issued by Movii, a financial services company, to users in the area. The card also ensures that customers have a simple and straightforward method to acquire crypto without the need to pay fees or deal …
articles.title: Binance Introduces Prepaid Crypto Card In Colombia
